channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @agquarx @sargoth One of the author’s earliest, and therefore not one of his best — which is why it is out of print. But how better to launch a SF career than to rebut RAH?

@agquarx @sargoth Better as a story. Not better as a prediction of 21st century American History.
@agquarx @sargoth Also, worth reading this rejoinder to Moon’s politics. https://t.co/eAv1TqjFR1
@trekonomics Read the fine print on yesterday’s decision. 17th century.

Authoritarian Jewish group hails authoritarian Supreme Court decision. https://t.co/rdceUhRCZt
Reminder: Haredi Judaism believes open inquiry into Jewish history is incompatible with their theology.
@matthew_petti @DandiaAsad What? No review of the local hummus spot? https://t.co/v9VahC3zHb
@RaffiMagarik It’s not like there are any antisemites in her home state who are trying to seize the reins of government…
@bruces Thank you for my next prompt. “Faraday's Law of Induction in the style of Charles Schultz.”
Please note that England was officially Judenrein during this period. https://t.co/ahvJ3coQqr
In which I commision some original artificial Monets. https://t.co/ng83UMuo2m
@FelurianFelicis @Dalle2Pics @CursedDalle2 Actually, two tables is a more catlike way to play the game!

@EladNehorai All we need is the right plaintiff and it could reinstate latent antisemitic covenants and exile half the Jews of Bergen County.
@EladNehorai Certainly any new Christian-only neighborhoods would be acceptable in the name of Religious Liberty, no doubt with a Kiryas Yoel case as precedent.
@Dalle2Pics @CursedDalle2 Cats playing ping pong in a garden in the style of monet
Funny which crimes the Times decides to both-sides. https://t.co/QMjl40dEKq

Poisonous business model: “selling straight to consumers is a shortcut. The US's food safety laws are crazy lax. That left grocery chains to basically force food safety onto food plants themselves by requiring audits.” Selling straight to consumers bypasses that safety step. https://t.co/ThKnyB8uhr
Keeps prices low but occasionally kills customers. Oops!
@theroncouch @KurtBusiek The thing about voting is that, unlike brushing your teeth, you’re only called upon to do it two or three times a year at most.
@onthemainline @ariella_kay Related: Wanting to be a “good” person to s an excellent motivation for hurting other people. https://t.co/cSPEJxUZe0
@JoelBerkowitz @SamuelSpinner @NTampio @katlekanye Nister hen, Nister herr, no?

@RabbiMarkAsherG That was a different era of jurisprudence. Today’s rogue SCOTUS is explicitly looking to 17th century British precedent, a time when the Church was fully established and the kingdom was judenrein. Anything is now fair game.
@Quiara I’d worry about a baby in space. Ain’t the kind of place to raise a kid.
@Quiara I think the plant behind her head is distracting. She should reposition it. Or blur the room background.
“Bee not afraid” is a vital sentiment, now more than ever. https://t.co/50QAs99raw https://t.co/sVrWmF9dY1
@ZacharyBraiterm RHS. Who has an undernoted teshuva on this I hope to finish translating this summer. https://t.co/oSVhZsfKf1

This all sounds amusing, but Maimonides, for one, was empowered by the the Egyptian government back in the day to lead the Jewish community. https://t.co/ry4k4siknn
It’s also worth noting that the lead halachic decisor for the Orthodox Union believes he has an exceptional understanding of how to rule in Jewish law that his equally knowledgeable colleagues who disagree with him lack.
The fact that something is absurd is no obstacle to it being used to prop up power.
@trekonomics Who would have imagined that RAH would be the liberal voice out times demand? https://t.co/TY5gwL4zSy
Putting politics — that is, the desires of the powerful — over the health of the public. “the White House asked her to water down guidance to states.” https://t.co/0Mwerywowy
